citeinfo.title: Daily and Monthly Marine Weather, Salinity, Currents, and Sea Temperature for Denmark and the Arctic Ocean (1936-55)

abstract.p: Publication Title: Nautisk-meteorologisk aarbog = Nautical-meteorological annual. Text in Danish and English. Volume/date ranges from 1897 to 1961.

Includes unsummarized daily observations for Denmark of ocean current speed and direction; sea temperature at selected depths; salinity at selected depths; monthly cloud amounts, temperature, salinity, wind speed and direction; and number of days with precipitation, snow, hail, fog, thunderstorm, and wind. Also contains maps showing the state of the ice in the Arctic seas. Station name, latitude, and longitude are given. A list of reporting ships, with their name, home port, Captain's name, location of observations, and period of record, is also included.

Oceanographical information continued by: Oceanografiske observationer fra danske fyrskibe og kyststationer; surface temperature information by: Manedlige over fladetemperaturer i det nordlige Atlanterhav; Arctic seas ice information by: Isforholdene i de Gronlandske farvande.
Available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/.

descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
